a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

div.script: var photoGallery1388= {"Album": {"title":"Homepage - 645x285","description":"","transitiondelay":"3","fadestyle":"NO","gallerywidth":"645","backgroundaudio":"/cms/lib/MT01001362/Centricity/ModuleInstance/1539/","loopaudio":"False","lgpath":"/cms/lib/MT01001362/Centricity/ModuleInstance/1539/large/","tnpath":"/cms/lib/MT01001362/Centricity/ModuleInstance/1539/thumbs/","Images": [{"photoname":"Logo - CPS - cropped website","src":"Logo - CPS - cropped website.jpg?rnd=0.757458734213122","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"}]}}

span.a: Conrad Public Schools - COVID 19 - Official Release #7

h4.span: This afternoon, Governor Bullock declared a Stay at Home/Shelter in Place order for the state of Montana. This declaration is to begin at 12:01 AM Saturday. Conrad Public Schools opened up a last minute pickup time Thursday afternoon from 4:25 - 6:00 PM in anticipation of this order. A vast majority of our students and parents were able to adjust to utilize this time. With this success, the original pickup time scheduled for Friday 7:15 - 9:00 AM has been cancelled. CPS will arrange individually for any materials that were unable to be picked up. All other school off-site services including Grab and Go meals will continue. Thank you for your action and patience as we navigate through these uncertain times.

hr.p: Trustee filing forms are due back to the district by tomorrow, March 26th, and if notarized, they can be mailed or emailed to the locations provided on page 2. Please see www.conradschools.org to print off a copy of the form.
Those who have filed thus far are:

Anna Walter
David Freebury
Meagan Heinen
Ronald Barnhill
Susan Bender

p.a: Declaration of Intent for School Board

p.strong: Governor Bullock mandated on 3/23/2020 extended closure of schools until 4/10/2020.
We will post an updated release from Superintendent Beddow soon.

h2.a: Conrad Public Schools - Covid-19 - Official Release #5 (pdf)

p.span: March 18, 2020, Release from the Governor's Office.
Here is the link for tonights school board meeting.

div.span: Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference room solution used around the world in board, confer...

Due to the district closure, Trustee filing forms can no longer be picked up or returned in person to the Central Office. Trustee filing forms are due back to the district by March 26th, and if notarized, they can be mailed or emailed to the locations provided on page 2.

span.a: Declaration of Intent for School Board

div.span: 3 Rivers Cooperative has volunteered to provide a 25 Mbps Internet connection at no cost to families who do not currently have Internet service with 3 Rivers while school remains closed. 3 Rivers Cooperative will not be able to install new wiring, but if the family has 3 Rivers telephone service in their household (or their household is wired for service) we should be able to connect them to the Internet.
Please fill out the following form.

The School Board Meeting scheduled for tomorrow, March 17, 2020, has been moved to a Zoom Room Meeting with a limited agenda. The limited agenda will include personnel agenda and certified contracts. The link will be published tomorrow evening to join the meeting.
The Transportation Committee meeting scheduled for March 17, 2020, has been postponed.

strong.a: Conrad Public Schools - COVID-19 - Official Release #4

h2.strong: Conrad Public Schools - Food Service Program to provide FREE meals for all families.

hr.div: As a district, we will provide 'brown bags' for breakfast and lunch items for any family who opts in to this service.

There will not be a daily order form for meals, it will be opt in for the entirety of the closure. All meals are free of charge!
To opt in, please complete the form below in its entirety.
--> If you want meals starting tomorrow 3/17, please let us know by 7pm via this form today, 3/16.
--> If you want ongoing meals beginning 3/18, complete this survey by 7pm as of 3/17.
Pick up for meals will be from 7:00am - 9:30am, Tuesday March 17 - Friday, March 27
Pick-up will be at the North Door of the Meadowlark Kitchen on the Elementary Playground. Please knock on the door when you arrive.
hr.h2: Google Form --> Conrad Public Schools - Food Service - Opt in for Meals During Mandated Closure
hr.div: Click link below for the official statement about the Conrad Public School's plan for mandated school closure

div.a: Conrad Public Schools - School Closure Release - March 15, 2020

hr.div: Conrad Public Schools and the Pondera County Health Department are asking for the assistance of any student/family enrolled in CPS. If you have traveled outside of the immediate vicinity of Pondera County over the last 2 weeks, please complete the online survey requesting travel information. This will help us properly screen any travelers and to do everything we can to continue education in a safe and healthy manner. Either the school or the county health department will contact any students and their families if they believe any interventions are necessary to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Thank you for doing your part to help keep our community safe.

div.span: The Junior High Wrestling Tournament scheduled for March 14, 2020, has been CANCELED.

br.span: Smiles Across Montana (SAM) is a dental hygiene program that focuses on dental disease prevention. Our
services are provided at your child’s school and there is no fee to the child or family for our services. Please click the link below for the consent

p.span: Copies of the calendar are available at your child's school

h3.span: If you have any suggestions for this website, please let us know by emailing: cstech@conradschools.org
